remarks: The converse of a poset is a poset.  In the general case ` ( ``' R e. PosetRel -> R e. PosetRel ) ` is not true.  See ~ cnvpsb for a special case where the property holds.  (Contributed by FL, 5-Jan-2009.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 3-Sep-2015.)
statement: cnvps $p |- ( R e. PosetRel -> `' R e. PosetRel ) $.
